main event: A civilian observer reported a sighting of a shiny, round object estimated to be 20 feet in diameter flying at approximately 600-700 MPH in East Point, Georgia.
interesting points: The object was observed for 30 seconds traveling in a NE to SW direction at an altitude of around 1,000 feet., The object had a thick center and tapered edges with a shiny appearance., No vapor or exhaust trail was visible., The sighting was potentially a balloon or aircraft according to comments in the report., A nuclear scientist in Georgia also reported sighting three unidentified flying objects using the same description.
